Authors: Shihomi Uzuhashi, Gen Okada, Moriya Ohkuma
Title:
Four new species of Pythium from aquatic environments in
Japan
Journal:
Antonie van Leeuwenhoek International Journal of General
and Molecular Microbiology
Keywords:
Diversity, Morphology, Oomycete, Phylogeny, Taxonomy,
Water
Abstract:
Four new species of Pythium, namely Pythium absentium, P.
brachiatum, P. biformum and P. junctum, were described based on the
morphological studies and molecular analyses. These species were
isolated from water samples collected from aquatic environments such as
pond or lakes in Japan. They were morphologically identified as Pythium
by their filamentous sporangia, and its identification were supported by
molecular phylogenetic analyses based on the internal transcribed spacer
(ITS) region and D1â“D2 region of large subunit (LSU) ribosomal RNA
gene, and mitochondrial cytochrome c oxidase subunit 1 gene. A
comparative study of the new species with closely related species, their
clade positions, and morphological features are described in this
article.
